intro: Xantolis cambodiana, commonly known as the Cambodian starfruit tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and fragrant, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are similar in appearance to starfruit, though less commonly cultivated. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
